chief executive in a surprising management reshuffling announced with the Internet company's fourth-quarter earnings, which jumped 29%. The Mountain View, Calif., company said the moves, effective April 4, were made to streamline decision-making and create clearer lines of responsibility and accountability at the top of the company. Eric Schmidt will no longer be responsible for the day-to-day operations. Instead, he will become exective chairman, focusing on deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships. spokesman for the Department for Education said Michael Gove will now look again at his decision on the six authorities "with an open mind", following representations from each council, as ordered by the judge. We are delighted that the judge did not call into question the decision to end the wasteful and bureaucratic Building Schools for the Future programme, he added. "On the substantive points he concluded that it was a rational decision and that the authorities involved had no expectation of being allowed to proceed with their projects." The judge

judge and new CNN talkshow host told Metro that he was shocked by the powerful position to which the the Liberal Democrat leader has since risen. Asked who were his most difficult interviewees, Piers Morgan said: Ones who emerge as fairly imbecilic. Nick Clegg stands out; my GQ interview with him was a series of spectacular own goals. "I thought,' I hope he never ends up running the country' and, whoa- here he is. How can this guy be so powerful? It's frightening. He added: " Simon Cowell was tough because we're friends but he was also my boss and he wouldn't be afraid to use that advantage- but it made for good TV." EastEnders:

the main trust of the disturbance appeared to be who would be forced to sit with Connecticut Barack Obama Sen. Joe Lieberman . Unnamed John McCain House Spokesman Wegman( Pudgy) Waterhouse, speaking on the condition of anonymity, said, It was wild there for a bit... everybody was cool at first. Lamar Alexander sort of paired up with Mike Bennet, Maria Cantwell sat with Barbara Boxer and Scott Brown, Orrin Hatch plumped down next to Jeanne Shaheen ... Sen. Joe Lieberman think Orrin Hatch was feeling lonely and he's always had a kind of thing for her... anyway, it was going okay, ya know? Then Sen. Joe Lieberman walked in and tried to sit next to Al Franken . That's when the shit started.
